longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the regulation of the sending of unsolicited electronic messages and for connected purposes.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Unsolicited Electronic Messages Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Account
def.leadIn: account (帳戶) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a free account;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a pre-paid account; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: anything that may reasonably be regarded as the equivalent of an account;

subsection.def: Authority (管理局) means the Communications Authority established by section 3 of the Communications Authority Ordinance (Cap. 616); (Added 17 of 2011 s. 28)
business (業務) includes a trade or profession;
commercial electronic mail message (商業電郵訊息) means a commercial electronic message sent to an electronic mail address;

def.name: CommercialElectronicMessage
def.leadIn: commercial electronic message (商業電子訊息) means an electronic message the purpose, or one of the purposes, of which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to offer to supply goods, services, facilities, land or an interest in land;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to offer to provide a business opportunity or an investment opportunity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to advertise or promote goods, services, facilities, land or an interest in land;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to advertise or promote a business opportunity or an investment opportunity;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to advertise or promote a supplier, or a prospective supplier, of goods, services, facilities, land or an interest in land; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to advertise or promote a provider, or a prospective provider, of a business opportunity or an investment opportunity,

def.continued: in the course of or in the furtherance of any business;

subsection.def: consent (同意) has the meaning assigned to it by section 5 (meaning of consent and related matters);
court (法院) includes a magistrate;

def.name: Document
def.leadIn: document (文件) includes, in addition to a document in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a disc, tape or other device in which data other than visual images are embodied so as to be capable, with or without the aid of some other equipment, of being reproduced from the disc, tape or other device; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a film, tape or other device in which visual images are embodied so as to be capable, with or without the aid of some other equipment, of being reproduced from the film, tape or other device;

subsection.def: domain name (域名) means a string (any sequence or combination of letters, characters, numbers or symbols of any language) registered with or allocated or assigned by a domain name authority as part of an electronic address on the Internet;
domain name authority (域名當局) means a domain name registrar, domain name registry or other domain name registration body;
do-not-call register (拒收訊息登記冊) means a register established and kept under section 31 (Authority may establish do-not-call registers);

electronic address (電子地址) means a string (any sequence or combination of letters, characters, numbers or symbols of any language) used to specify a source or destination of an electronic message and includes, but is not limited to, an electronic mail address, Internet protocol address, instant messaging account name, telephone number and facsimile number;

electronic mail address (電郵地址) means an electronic address consisting of a user name or mailbox (commonly referred to as the “local part”) and a reference to a domain name (commonly referred to as the “domain part”), whether or not displayed, to which an electronic message can be sent;

def.name: ElectronicMessage
def.leadIn: electronic message (電子訊息) includes a message in any form sent over a public telecommunications service to an electronic address and includes, but is not limited to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a text, voice, sound, image or video message; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a message combining text, voice, sound, images or video;

subsection.def: enforcement notice (執行通知) means a notice under section 38(1) (Authority may issue enforcement notice);
function (職能) includes a power and a duty;

def.name: HongKongCompany
def.leadIn: Hong Kong company (香港公司) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company within the meaning assigned by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate that is incorporated or otherwise established by or under any other Ordinance;

subsection.def: Hong Kong link (香港聯繫) has the meaning assigned to it by section 3 (meaning of Hong Kong link);
legal proceedings (法律程序) means legal proceedings of any kind, whether civil or criminal and whether under this Ordinance or otherwise;
mistake (錯誤) means a reasonable mistake of fact;

def.name: Organization
def.leadIn: organization (機構) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a Hong Kong company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other company or body corporate, wherever incorporated or otherwise established; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a partnership or other unincorporated body of persons, whether formed or established in Hong Kong or elsewhere;

subsection.def: public telecommunications network (公共電訊網絡) means a telecommunications network offered for use by the general public;
public telecommunications service (公共電訊服務) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106);

def.name: RegisteredUser
def.leadIn: registered user (登記使用者), in relation to the sending of a commercial electronic message to an electronic address, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the electronic address is an electronic mail address, the individual or organization who is responsible for the relevant electronic mail address account;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the message is sent to an electronic address in connection with an instant messaging service, the individual or organization who is responsible for the relevant instant messaging account;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the electronic address is a telephone number or facsimile number, the individual or organization who is responsible for the relevant telephone or facsimile account; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in any other case, the individual or organization who is responsible for the relevant electronic address account,

def.continued: and, if 2 or more individuals or organizations are jointly responsible for such an account, means any of those individuals or organizations;

subsection.def: Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development; (Amended L.N. 141 of 2007)
send (發送) has the meaning assigned to it by section 4 (meaning of send and related matters);
software (軟件) includes a combination of software and associated data;
supply (供應) means supply by way of sale, transfer, exchange, lease, hire or hire-purchase;
telecommunications (電訊) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106);
telecommunications device (電訊裝置) includes any computer, instrument, apparatus or equipment used for the purpose of telecommunications;
telecommunications network (電訊網絡) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106);
telecommunications service (電訊服務) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106);
telecommunications service provider (電訊服務提供者) means a licensee as defined in section 2(1) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106);
unsubscribe request (取消接收要求) has the meaning assigned to it by section 9(4) (commercial electronic messages must contain unsubscribe facility);

working day (工作日) means any day other than a public holiday or a black rainstorm warning day or gale warning day within the meaning assigned by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f) of the definition of commercial electronic message in subsection (1), it is immaterial whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the goods, services, facilities, land, interest in land, business opportunity or investment opportunity exists; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is lawful to acquire the goods, services, facilities, land, interest in land, business opportunity or investment opportunity.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of electronic message in subsection (1), it is immaterial whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the electronic address exists; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the message reaches its intended destination.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to the performance of a function includes the exercise of a power and the discharge of a duty.

For the avoidance of doubt, references in this Ordinance to organizations shall not be construed as implying that references to persons do not include companies, bodies corporate, partnerships or other bodies of persons.

Where, in any provision of this Ordinance, a reference is made to another provision of this Ordinance and the reference is followed by text in parenthesis that purports to be descriptive of the subject matter of the provision referred to, the text in parenthesis shall be treated as having been provided for information only and does not have any legislative effect.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a commercial electronic message has a Hong Kong link if, and only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the message originates in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the individual or organization who sent the message or authorized the sending of the message is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an individual who is physically present in Hong Kong when the message is sent;

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: a Hong Kong company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the telecommunications device that is used to access the message is located in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the registered user of the electronic address to which the message is sent is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an individual who is physically present in Hong Kong when the message is accessed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an organization that is carrying on business or activities in Hong Kong when the message is accessed; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the message is sent to an electronic address that is allocated or assigned by the Authority.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), (c), (d) and (e), it is immaterial whether the commercial electronic message originates in Hong Kong or elsewhere.
For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(iii), it is immaterial whether the commercial electronic message is sent, or is authorized to be sent, from Hong Kong or elsewhere.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Meaning of send and related matters

subsection.def: For the purposes of this Ordinance, send (發送), in relation to an electronic message, includes cause to be sent and attempt to send.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance (including subsection (3)), if an individual authorizes the sending of a commercial electronic message and he does so on behalf of an organization, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the organization shall be treated as authorizing the sending of the message; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the individual shall be treated as not authorizing the sending of the message.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a commercial electronic message is sent by an individual or organization; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sending of the message is not authorized by any other individual or organization,

subsection.continued: the first-mentioned individual or organization shall be treated as authorizing the sending of the message.

subsection.content: For the purposes of any legal proceedings, a telecommunications service provider who merely provides a service that enables a commercial electronic message to be sent shall, unless the contrary is proved, be presumed not to have sent the message and not to have authorized the message to be sent.

For the purposes of any legal proceedings, if a commercial electronic message is sent and at the relevant time the telecommunications device, service or network from which it was sent was controlled by a person without the knowledge of the owners or authorized users of the telecommunications device, service or network, the owners or authorized users shall, unless the contrary is proved, be presumed not to have sent the message and not to have authorized the message to be sent.

subsection.def: In subsection (5), control (控制) means either physical control or control through the use of software or other means.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Meaning of consent and related matters

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

def.name: Consent
def.leadIn: consent (同意), in relation to the sending of a commercial electronic message, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: express consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consent that can reasonably be inferred from the conduct of the individual or organization concerned;

subsection.def: withdraw (撤回), in relation to consent, means to expressly withdraw that consent.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, consent to the sending of a commercial electronic message may be given, and such consent may be withdrawn, by means of an electronic message or in any other manner.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, the registered user of an electronic address shall be treated as having given his consent to the sending of a commercial electronic message to that electronic address if the registered user or a person on his behalf—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has, either in response to a clear and conspicuous request for consent or at his own initiative, given his consent to the sending of the message; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not, within a reasonable period of time prior to the sending of the message, withdrawn that consent.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance (including subsection (3)), if a person other than the registered user of an electronic address uses the relevant account to send an electronic message about—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdrawal of consent,

subsection.continued: that person shall be treated as having been authorized to send that message on behalf of the registered user.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) shall not be construed as limiting the circumstances in which a person other than the registered user of an electronic address may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: withdraw consent,

subsection.continued: on behalf of the registered user.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, the registered user of an electronic address may at any time withdraw any consent given by him to the sending of a commercial electronic message.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Application

subsection.content: This Ordinance binds the Government.
Neither the Government nor any public officer in the officer’s capacity as such is liable to be prosecuted for an offence against this Ordinance.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Exemptions

subsection.content: The matters specified in Schedule 1 are exempt from the application of this Ordinance to the extent and subject to the conditions, if any, specified in that Schedule.
The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Rules about Sending Commercial Electronic Messages

section.name: s8
section.heading: Commercial electronic messages must include accurate sender information

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not send a commercial electronic message that has a Hong Kong link unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the message includes clear and accurate information identifying the individual or organization who authorized the sending of the message;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the message includes clear and accurate information about how the recipient can readily contact that individual or organization;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the message includes such information and complies with such conditions as is or are specified in the regulations, if any; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the information included in the message in compliance with this subsection is reasonably likely to be valid for at least 30 days after the message is sent.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sent the commercial electronic message by mistake; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know, and could not with reasonable diligence have ascertained, that the message had a Hong Kong link.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Commercial electronic messages must contain unsubscribe facility

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not send a commercial electronic message that has a Hong Kong link unless—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a statement to the effect that the recipient may use an electronic address or other electronic means specified in the message (the unsubscribe facility) to send an unsubscribe request to the individual or organization who authorized the sending of the message; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a statement to similar effect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the statement is presented in a clear and conspicuous manner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the statement complies with such conditions as are specified in the regulations, if any;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the unsubscribe facility complies with such conditions as are specified in the regulations, if any;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the unsubscribe facility is a telephone number or facsimile number, it is a number allocated or assigned by the Authority;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the unsubscribe facility is reasonably likely to be capable of receiving the recipient’s unsubscribe request, if any, at all times during a period of at least 30 days after the message is sent; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the unsubscribe request may be sent by the recipient free of any charge to the recipient for the use of the unsubscribe facility.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sent the commercial electronic message by mistake; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know, and could not with reasonable diligence have ascertained, that the message had a Hong Kong link.

subsection.content: A person to whom an unsubscribe request is sent under this section shall ensure that a record of the request is retained in the format in which it was originally received, or in a format that can be demonstrated to represent accurately the information originally received, for at least 3 years after its receipt.

def.name: UnsubscribeRequest
def.leadIn: In this section, unsubscribe request (取消接收要求), in relation to a commercial electronic message the sending of which is authorized by an individual or organization, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a message to the effect that the registered user of the electronic address to which the message is sent does not wish to receive, at that electronic address, any further commercial electronic messages from or authorized by that individual or organization; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a message to similar effect.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Commercial electronic messages must not be sent after unsubscribe request is sent

subsection.content: This section applies if a person sends an unsubscribe request to an individual or organization using the unsubscribe facility provided under section 9 (commercial electronic messages must contain unsubscribe facility).

subsection.leadIn: The individual or organization shall, within 10 working days from the day on which the unsubscribe request is sent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cease sending any further commercial electronic messages to the electronic address in respect of which the unsubscribe request was sent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cease authorizing the sending of any further commercial electronic messages to that electronic address.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) does not apply in relation to a commercial electronic message if, subsequent to the sending of the unsubscribe request, the registered user of the relevant electronic address has given his consent to the sending of the message.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply in relation to a commercial electronic message if the individual or organization concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sent the message, or authorized it to be sent, by mistake; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know, and could not with reasonable diligence have ascertained, that the message had a Hong Kong link.

subsection.def: In this section, unsubscribe facility (取消接收選項) has the same meaning as in section 9 (commercial electronic messages must contain unsubscribe facility).

section.name: s11
section.heading: Commercial electronic messages must not be sent to electronic address listed in do-not-call register

subsection.content: A person shall not send a commercial electronic message that has a Hong Kong link to an electronic address that, at the time the message is sent, is listed in a do-not-call register.

Subsection (1) does not apply in relation to a commercial electronic message if, prior to or subsequent to the listing of the electronic address in the do-not-call register, and whether before or after the commencement of this section, the registered user of the electronic address has given his consent to the sending of the message.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the electronic address has been listed in the do-not-call register for less than 10 working days at the time the commercial electronic message is sent.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sent the commercial electronic message by mistake; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know, and could not with reasonable diligence have ascertained, that the message had a Hong Kong link.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Commercial electronic mail messages must not use misleading subject headings
section.content: A person shall not send a commercial electronic mail message that has a Hong Kong link if the subject heading of the message, if any, would be likely to mislead the recipient about a material fact regarding the content or subject matter of the message.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Commercial electronic messages must not be sent with calling line identification information concealed

subsection.leadIn: A person who sends a commercial electronic message that has a Hong Kong link from an electronic address that is a telephone number or facsimile number (the sending number) shall not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: conceal or withhold from the called party the calling line identification information of the sending number; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: perform any operation or issue any instruction in connection with the sending of the message for the purpose of, or that has the effect of, concealing or withholding from the called party the calling line identification information of the sending number.

subsection.def: In this section, calling line identification information (來電線路識別資料) means telecommunications network information generated and transmitted by the calling party’s telecommunications network for the purpose of enabling the called party’s telecommunications network to identify the telephone number or facsimile number of the calling party.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Rules about Address-harvesting and Related Activities

section.name: s14
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: AddressharvestingSoftware
def.leadIn: address-harvesting software (地址收集軟件) means software that is specifically designed or marketed for use for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: searching the Internet or a public telecommunications network for electronic addresses; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: collecting, compiling, capturing or otherwise obtaining those electronic addresses;

def.name: HarvestedaddressList
def.leadIn: harvested-address list (地址收集清單) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a list of electronic addresses;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a collection of electronic addresses; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a compilation of electronic addresses,

def.continued: where the production of the list, collection or compilation is, to any extent, directly or indirectly attributable to the use of address-harvesting software.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, a person sends multiple commercial electronic messages if he sends more than 100 commercial electronic messages during a 24-hour period or more than 1 000 commercial electronic messages during a 30-day period.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Supply of address-harvesting software or harvested-address list

subsection.leadIn: No person shall supply or offer to supply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: address-harvesting software;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a right to use address-harvesting software;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a harvested-address list; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a right to use a harvested-address list,

subsection.continued: to another person (the customer) for use in connection with, or to facilitate, the sending of commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link without the consent of the registered users of the electronic addresses to which they are sent.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.
A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

It is a defence to a charge for an offence under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that he did not know and had no reason to suspect that the customer, or another person, intended to use the address-harvesting software or the harvested-address list, as the case may be, in connection with, or to facilitate, the sending of commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link without the consent of the registered users of the electronic addresses to which they are sent.

It is a defence to a charge for an offence under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that he took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Acquisition of address-harvesting software or harvested-address list

subsection.leadIn: No person shall acquire—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: address-harvesting software;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a right to use address-harvesting software;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a harvested-address list; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a right to use a harvested-address list,

subsection.continued: for use in connection with, or to facilitate, the sending of commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link without the consent of the registered users of the electronic addresses to which they are sent.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.
A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

It is a defence to a charge for an offence under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that he took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Use of address-harvesting software or harvested-address list

subsection.leadIn: No person shall use—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: address-harvesting software; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a harvested-address list,

subsection.continued: in connection with, or to facilitate, the sending of commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link without the consent of the registered users of the electronic addresses to which they are sent.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.
A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

It is a defence to a charge for an offence under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that he took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.

subsection.def: In this section, use (用、使用) does not include the act of forwarding the address-harvesting software or harvested-address list to another person.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Sending of commercial electronic message to electronic address obtained using automated means

subsection.content: No person shall send a commercial electronic message that has a Hong Kong link to an electronic address that was obtained using an automated means.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.
A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

It is a defence to a charge for an offence under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that he did not know and had no reason to suspect that the electronic address was obtained using an automated means.

It is a defence to a charge for an offence under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that he took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: automated means (自動化方法) means an automated process that generates possible electronic addresses by combining letters, characters, numbers or symbols into numerous permutations;

def.name: Obtained
def.leadIn: obtained (取得), in relation to an electronic address, means obtained, whether before or after the commencement of this section, by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person charged; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person from or through whom the person charged acquired the electronic address.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Use of scripts or other automated means to register for 5 or more electronic mail addresses

subsection.content: No person shall use scripts or other automated means to register for 5 or more electronic mail addresses from which to send, or enable another person to send, multiple commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link without the consent of the registered users of the electronic addresses to which they are sent.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years.
A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who performs functions in connection with the administration of the information systems of an organization, when performing such functions; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a telecommunications service provider, when acting in connection with the provision of a public telecommunications service.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Register
def.leadIn: register (登記), in relation to an electronic mail address, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to register with an authority responsible for allocating or assigning the electronic mail address or approving its allocation or assignment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be allocated or assigned the electronic mail address with the approval of such an authority;

subsection.def: scripts (手稿程式) means a list of instructions or commands to an information system.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Relay or retransmission of multiple commercial electronic messages

subsection.content: No person shall use a telecommunications device, service or network to relay or retransmit multiple commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link, with the intent to deceive or mislead recipients, or any telecommunications service provider, as to the source of such messages.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction, to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment, to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Fraud and Other Illicit Activities Related to Transmission of Commercial Electronic Messages

section.name: s21
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: Initiate
def.leadIn: initiate (啟動), in relation to a commercial electronic message, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to originate or send such a message;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to procure the origination or sending of such a message; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to attempt to originate or send, or procure the origination or sending of, such a message,

def.continued: but does not include actions that constitute the routine conveyance of such a message;

subsection.def: routine conveyance (例行傳遞) means the transmission, routing, relaying, handling or storing, through an automatic technical process, of an electronic message in relation to which message another person has identified the recipient or provided the recipient’s electronic address.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part, a person initiates the transmission of multiple commercial electronic messages from a telecommunications device, service or network if he initiates the transmission of more than 100 commercial electronic messages during a 24-hour period, or more than 1 000 commercial electronic messages during a 30-day period, from that telecommunications device, service or network.
For the purposes of this Part, more than one person may be considered to have initiated the transmission of a commercial electronic message or multiple commercial electronic messages.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Initiating transmission of multiple commercial electronic messages from telecommunications device, etc., accessed without authorization

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accesses a telecommunications device, service or network without authorization; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knowingly initiates the transmission of multiple commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link from that telecommunications device, service or network,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 10 years.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person accesses a telecommunications device, service or network without authorization if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he accesses that telecommunications device, service or network by any means or in any manner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is not entitled to obtain such access; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he has not been authorized to obtain such access by any person who is entitled to grant him such access.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Initiating transmission of multiple commercial electronic messages with intent to deceive or mislead recipients as to source of messages

subsection.content: A person who knowingly initiates the transmission of multiple commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link from a telecommunications device, service or network without authorization, with the intent to deceive or mislead recipients as to the source of such messages, commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 10 years.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person initiates the transmission of a commercial electronic message from a telecommunications device, service or network without authorization if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he initiates the transmission of the message from that telecommunications device, service or network by any means or in any manner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is not entitled to initiate that transmission; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he has not been authorized to initiate that transmission by any person who is entitled to authorize him to initiate the transmission.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Falsifying header information in multiple commercial electronic messages

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: materially falsifies header information in multiple commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knowingly initiates the transmission of such messages from a telecommunications device, service or network,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 10 years.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1) but subject to subsection (3), a person materially falsifies header information in a commercial electronic message if he falsifies, alters, conceals, deletes or withholds any information in such manner as to impair the ability of the recipient of the message, a telecommunications service provider processing the message or any other person to identify, locate or respond to the person who initiated the transmission of the message.

For the purposes of subsection (1) and in relation to the sending of a commercial electronic message from an electronic address that is a telephone number or facsimile number (the sending number), the person initiating the transmission of such a message shall not be treated as having materially falsified header information by reason only that he has performed any operation or issued any instruction in connection with the sending of the message for the purpose of, or that has the effect of, concealing or withholding from the called party the calling line identification information of the sending number.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: calling line identification information (來電線路識別資料) has the same meaning as in section 13(2) (commercial electronic messages must not be sent with calling line identification information concealed );

def.name: HeaderInformation
def.leadIn: header information (標頭資料) means the information attached to a commercial electronic message by a telecommunications device, service or network for the purpose of identifying, or purporting to identify, the person sending the message or the source, routing or destination of the message, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a commercial electronic mail message, includes, but is not limited to, the originating domain name, Internet protocol address and electronic mail address, but excludes the content in the SMTP data portion; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: SMTP data portion(《簡單郵遞傳送規約》數據部分) has the meaning assigned to it by the Simple Mail Transfer Protocol of Internet Official Protocol Standards, or any successor protocols, published by the Internet Engineering Task Force, or any of its successors, as amended from time to time.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Registering for electronic addresses or domain names using information that falsifies identity of actual registrant

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: registers, using information that materially falsifies the identity of the actual registrant, for 5 or more electronic addresses or 2 or more domain names; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knowingly initiates the transmission of multiple commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link from any of such electronic addresses or domain names or from any combination of such electronic addresses or domain names,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 10 years.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person uses information that materially falsifies the identity of the actual registrant if he falsifies, alters, conceals, deletes or withholds any information in such manner as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impair the ability of the relevant authority responsible for allocating or assigning the electronic address or approving its allocation or assignment or the relevant domain name authority, as the case may be, to identify or locate the actual registrant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impair the ability of the recipient of any commercial electronic message transmitted from the electronic address or domain name, a telecommunications service provider processing the message or any other person to identify, locate or respond to the person who initiated the transmission of the message.

def.name: Register
def.leadIn: In this section, register (登記、註冊) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an electronic address—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to register with an authority responsible for allocating or assigning the electronic address or approving its allocation or assignment; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to procure the allocation or assignment of the electronic address, or the approval of its allocation or assignment, by such an authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a domain name, to register the domain name with, or to procure its allocation or assignment by, any domain name authority.

section.name: s26
section.heading: False representations regarding registrant or successor in interest to registrant of electronic address or domain name

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: falsely represents himself to be the registrant or the legitimate successor in interest to the registrant of 5 or more electronic addresses or 2 or more domain names; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knowingly initiates the transmission of multiple commercial electronic messages that have a Hong Kong link from any of such electronic addresses or domain names or from any combination of such electronic addresses or domain names,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine and to imprisonment for 10 years.

subsection.def: In this section, registrant (登記人、註冊人) means a person who registers for an electronic address or domain name within the meaning assigned by section 25(3) (registering for electronic addresses or domain names using information that falsifies identity of actual registrant).

section.name: s27
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5
section.def: approved code of practice (認可實務守則) has the meaning assigned to it by section 29(8) (Authority may approve codes of practice);
authorized officer (獲授權人員) means a public officer authorized by the Authority under section 28 (Authority may appoint authorized officers);
specified offence (指明罪行) means an offence under this Part or Part 3 (rules about address-harvesting and related activities) or Part 7 (miscellaneous).

section.name: s28
section.heading: Authority may appoint authorized officers
section.content: The Authority may authorize in writing any public officer to perform any of the functions conferred or imposed on authorized officers by this Part as are specified in the authorization.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Authority may approve codes of practice

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), for the purpose of providing practical guidance in respect of the application or operation of any provision of this Ordinance, the Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve and issue such codes of practice (whether prepared by it or not) as in its opinion are suitable for that purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve such codes of practice issued or proposed to be issued otherwise than by it as in its opinion are suitable for that purpose. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: A code of practice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may consist of a code, standard, rule, specification or any other documentary form of practical guidance prepared by the Authority or other body or authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may apply, incorporate or refer to any document that has been formulated or published by a body or authority either as in force at the time the document is approved by the Authority or as amended, formulated or published from time to time.

subsection.leadIn: Where a code of practice is approved under subsection (1), the Authority shall, by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code concerned and specify the date on which its approval is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the provision or provisions of this Ordinance for which the code is so approved.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from time to time revise the whole or any part of any code of practice prepared by it under this section; and (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve any revision or proposed revision of the whole or any part of any code of practice for the time being approved under this section.

subsection.content: The provisions of subsection (3) shall, with the necessary modifications, apply in relation to any revision or approval under subsection (4) as they apply in relation to the approval of a code of practice under subsection (1).
The Authority may at any time withdraw its approval from any code of practice approved under this section. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

Where under subsection (6) the Authority withdraws its approval from a code of practice approved under this section, it shall, by notice published in the Gazette, identify the code concerned and specify the date on which its approval is to cease to have effect. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

References in this Ordinance to an approved code of practice are references to that code as approved under this section and as it has effect for the time being, including by virtue of any revision of the whole or any part of it approved under this section.

The power of the Authority under subsection (1)(b) to approve a code of practice issued or proposed to be issued otherwise than by it shall include the power to approve a part of such a code and, accordingly, in this Ordinance, code of practice may be read as including a part of such a code. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)
A code of practice approved under this section and a notice published under subsection (3) or (7) are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Use of approved codes of practice in legal proceedings

subsection.content: A failure on the part of any person to observe any provision of an approved code of practice shall not of itself render that person liable to legal proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: However, if, in any legal proceedings, the court is satisfied that a provision of an approved code of practice is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue in the proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the code of practice is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person contravened or did not contravene a relevant provision of the code of practice may be relied on by any party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate that matter.

subsection.content: In any legal proceedings, a code of practice that appears to a court to be the subject of a notice under section 29(3) (Authority may approve codes of practice) shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be presumed to be the subject of such notice.

In any legal proceedings, a document that purports to be a copy of a code of practice that is the subject of a notice under section 29(3) (Authority may approve codes of practice) shall, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, be presumed to be a true copy of the code.

def.name: Court
def.leadIn: In this section, court (法院) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a magistrate;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Unsolicited Electronic Messages (Enforcement Notices) Appeal Board established under section 47(1); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other tribunal.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Authority may establish do-not-call registers

subsection.content: The Authority may establish and keep one or more registers of electronic addresses for the purposes of this Ordinance, each of which is to be known as a do-not-call register, and may do all things necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the establishment, operation and administration of such registers.

subsection.leadIn: The purposes of a do-not-call register are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide registered users of electronic addresses with a convenient means by which they may notify senders of commercial electronic messages that they do not wish to receive such messages at those electronic addresses; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to provide senders of commercial electronic messages with a convenient means by which they may ascertain whether a registered user of an electronic address does not wish to receive unsolicited commercial electronic messages at that electronic address.

subsection.content: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the Authority may establish and keep separate do-not-call registers for different kinds of electronic addresses.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), a do-not-call register may be kept in such form as the Authority considers appropriate including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a documentary form; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a form other than a documentary form.

subsection.content: If a do-not-call register is kept in a form other than a documentary form, then the information contained in it must be capable of being reproduced in a legible form.

subsection.leadIn: A document purporting to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of an entry in or extract of a do-not-call register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certified by the Authority or an authorized officer as a true copy of the entry or extract referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: shall be admissible as evidence of its contents in any legal proceedings.

subsection.content: A certificate purporting to be signed by the Authority or an authorized officer and stating that an electronic address was or was not listed in a do-not-call register at a date specified in the certificate shall be admissible as evidence of its contents in any legal proceedings.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Powers of Authority in relation to do-not-call registers

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of section 31(1) (Authority may establish do-not-call registers), the Authority may determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the criteria for determining whether an electronic address is eligible to be listed in a do-not-call register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the procedures for adding an electronic address to a do-not-call register;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which and the manner in which an electronic address may be removed from a do-not-call register;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the fees to be paid for the provision by the Authority of any service in relation to a do-not-call register; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other matter relating to the establishment, operation or administration of a do-not-call register.

subsection.content: The Authority shall not add an electronic address to a do-not-call register unless the registered user of that electronic address has given his consent to its inclusion in the register and to its being made available under section 33 (access to do-not-call registers).

section.name: s33
section.heading: Access to do-not-call registers

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Authority shall, having regard to the purposes described in section 31(2) (Authority may establish do-not-call registers), cause the information contained in a do-not-call register to be made available to senders of commercial electronic messages.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, for the purpose of performing its functions under subsection (1), determine— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procedures to be followed by any person who wishes to obtain access to information contained in a do-not-call register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions that must be met before such information is made available to any person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the form in which and the manner in which such information is made available to any person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the conditions subject to which such information is made available to any person; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other matter relating to the provision by the Authority to any person of any such information.

subsection.content: Without limiting the powers of the Authority under section 32(1)(e) (powers of Authority in relation to do-not-call registers) but subject to subsection (4), the Authority may charge fees for making information contained in a do-not-call register available to any person under this section.
The Authority shall provide facilities to enable the registered user of an electronic address to verify, free of charge, whether that electronic address is listed in a do-not-call register.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Authority may issue directions to telecommunications service providers

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Authority may, by notice in writing served on a telecommunications service provider, issue directions to the telecommunications service provider requiring it to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: take such action as the Authority considers necessary for the purpose of assisting the Authority to determine whether to commence an investigation into a contravention or suspected contravention of a provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take such action as the Authority considers necessary for the purpose of assisting or enabling the Authority to investigate a contravention or suspected contravention of a provision of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide information to the Authority for the purpose of assisting or enabling the Authority to establish, operate or administer a do-not-call register,

subsection.continued: and the telecommunications service provider shall give effect to such directions before a date specified in the notice, being a date reasonable in all the circumstances of the case.

subsection.content: No directions shall be issued to a telecommunications service provider under subsection (1) in relation to a matter for which the Authority may serve a notice on the telecommunications service provider under section 36 (Authority may obtain information or documents relevant to investigation) or section 38 (Authority may issue enforcement notice).

No directions shall be issued to a telecommunications service provider under subsection (1) unless the Authority is satisfied that the telecommunications service provider has been afforded a reasonable opportunity to make representations to the Authority.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Authority may impose financial penalties

subsection.content: The Authority may, by notice in writing served on a telecommunications service provider, require the telecommunications service provider to pay to the Government the financial penalty specified in the notice in any case where it fails to comply with any direction issued in respect of the telecommunications service provider under section 34 (Authority may issue directions to telecommunications service providers).

subsection.leadIn: A financial penalty imposed on a telecommunications service provider under subsection (1) shall not exceed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: $50,000 for the first occasion on which a financial penalty is so imposed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: $100,000 for the second occasion on which a financial penalty is so imposed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: $200,000 for any subsequent occasion on which a financial penalty is so imposed.

subsection.content: The Authority shall not impose a financial penalty under this section unless, in all the circumstances of the case, the financial penalty is proportionate and reasonable in relation to the failure or series of failures concerned giving rise to that financial penalty.

The Authority shall not impose a financial penalty under this section unless it has given the telecommunications service provider concerned a reasonable opportunity to make representations, and the Authority shall consider all representations made to it before it makes a decision whether or not to impose a financial penalty. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

Subsection (1) shall not apply in the case of the telecommunications service provider concerned unless the Authority is satisfied that it has been afforded a reasonable opportunity of complying with the direction in respect of which that subsection is sought to be applied.
A financial penalty imposed under this section is recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Authority may obtain information or documents relevant to investigation

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority is satisfied that there are reasonable grounds for believing that a person is, or is likely to be, in possession of information (including but not limited to passwords) or a document that is relevant to the Authority’s investigation of a contravention or suspected contravention of a provision of this Ordinance, the Authority may serve a notice in writing on the person, accompanied by a copy of this section in Chinese and English—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: give the information in writing to the Authority; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: produce the document to the Authority,

paragraph.continued: as the case requires, before a date (the relevant date) specified in the notice, being a date reasonable in all the circumstances of the case; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: stating that if the person is of the view that he cannot, or does not wish to, comply with the request, then he may make representations in writing to the Authority as to why he is of that view before the relevant date.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority receives representations referred to in subsection (1)(b) from a person, the Authority shall, after considering the representations, serve a notice in writing on the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stating that the Authority has considered the representations; and

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: that the notice served on the person under subsection (1) remains in force and the Authority will on a date specified in the notice served under this subsection seek an order under subsection (3) unless the person has, before that date, complied with the notice served on the person under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Where a notice served on a person under subsection (1) has not been withdrawn under subsection (2)(b)(i) and the person has not complied with the notice before the relevant date, or before the date specified in the notice served on the person under subsection (2), as the case may be, then a magistrate may, on application by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for believing that the person is, or is likely to be, in possession of the information or a document to which the first-mentioned notice relates and that the information or document is relevant to the Authority’s investigation of a contravention or suspected contravention of a provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after considering the representations, if any, referred to in subsection (1)(b) received by the Authority in consequence of the service of the first-mentioned notice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: after considering the representations, if any, made by the Authority or the person on the hearing of the application,

subsection.continued: issue an order that the person shall, within the time specified in the order, give the information in writing to the Authority or produce the document to the Authority, as the case requires.

subsection.leadIn: The person in respect of whom an application is made by the Authority under subsection (3) shall be entitled to be heard on the hearing of the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the person is an individual, either in person or through a counsel or solicitor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the person is an organization, either through a counsel or solicitor or through—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a Hong Kong company or other company or body corporate, any of its directors or other officers;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a partnership, any of its partners; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in the case of any other organization, any of its officers.

subsection.content: Any information or document to be given or produced to the Authority by a person in compliance with a notice under subsection (1) or an order under subsection (3) shall be so given or produced by reference to the information or document at the time of service of that notice except that the information or document may take account of any processing that was done between the time of service and the time when the information or document is so given or produced if that processing would have been done irrespective of the service of that notice.

For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that where a person gives or produces any information or document under this section notwithstanding that the information or document is the subject of a confidentiality agreement with another person that prevents the first-mentioned person from releasing the information or document, the first-mentioned person shall not be liable for any civil liability or claim whatever in respect of the giving or production of that information or document, as the case may be, contrary to that agreement.

Nothing in this section shall require a person to give any information, or to produce any document, that the person could not be compelled to give in evidence, or produce, in civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if he, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with an order under subsection (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to comply with subsection (5); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a notice under subsection (1) or an order under subsection (3), knowingly gives information that is false or misleading,

subsection.continued: and shall be liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.def: In this section, processing (處理), in relation to any information or document, includes amending, augmenting, deleting or rearranging all or any part of the information or document, whether by automated means or otherwise.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Disclosure of information and documents given or produced under section 36

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall not disclose any information or document given or produced to it under section 36 (Authority may obtain information or documents relevant to investigation) unless it is satisfied that— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is necessary to disclose the information or document for the purposes of a proceeding under subsection (3) of that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is necessary to disclose the information or document for the purposes of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the prevention or detection of crime;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the apprehension, prosecution or detention of offenders; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the fulfilment of any obligation under an international agreement applicable to Hong Kong and relating to unsolicited electronic messages; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is otherwise in the public interest to disclose the information or document.

subsection.content: The Authority shall not disclose any information or document given or produced to it under section 36 (Authority may obtain information or documents relevant to investigation) unless it has given the person who gave or produced the information or document to the Authority a reasonable opportunity to make representations on the proposed disclosure, and the Authority shall consider all representations made to it before it makes a decision whether or not to disclose the information or document, as the case may be. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

section.name: s38
section.heading: Authority may issue enforcement notice

subsection.leadIn: Where the Authority is of the opinion that any person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is contravening any provision of Part 2 (rules about sending commercial electronic messages); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has contravened any provision of Part 2 (rules about sending commercial electronic messages) in circumstances that make it likely that the contravention will continue or be repeated,

subsection.continued: then the Authority may serve a notice in writing on the person, accompanied by a copy of this section in Chinese and English—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stating that it is of that opinion; (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: specifying the contravention as to which it is of that opinion and the reasons why it believes it is a contravention; and (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: directing the person to take such steps as are specified in the notice to remedy the contravention or the matters occasioning the service of the notice, as the case may be, within such period as is specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The steps specified in an enforcement notice to remedy any contravention or matter to which the notice relates may be framed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to any extent by reference to any approved code of practice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so as to afford the relevant person a choice between different ways of remedying the contravention or matter, as the case may be.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (4), the period specified in an enforcement notice for taking the steps specified in it shall not expire before the end of the period specified in section 48 (appeals to Appeal Board) within which an appeal against the notice may be made.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority is of the opinion that by reason of special circumstances the steps specified in an enforcement notice should be taken as a matter of urgency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it may include a statement to that effect in the notice together with the reasons why it is of that opinion; and (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where such a statement is so included, subsection (3) shall not apply but the notice shall not require those steps to be taken before the end of the period of 7 days beginning with the date on which the notice was served.

subsection.content: The Authority may cancel an enforcement notice by notice in writing served on the relevant person.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Offence relating to enforcement notices

subsection.content: A person who contravenes an enforcement notice served on him under section 38 (Authority may issue enforcement notice) commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under this section is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a first conviction, to a fine at level 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a second or subsequent conviction, to a fine of $500,000,

subsection.continued: and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further daily fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: It is a defence to a charge for an offence under this section for the person charged to prove that he exercised all due diligence to comply with the enforcement notice.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Powers of entry, search, arrest, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority or an authorized officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without warrant, arrest any person whom the Authority or authorized officer reasonably suspects of having committed a specified offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where a warrant has been issued under section 41(1) (power of magistrate to issue search warrant) in respect of any premises or place—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: enter and search the premises or place;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: detain any person found in or on the premises or place, during such period as is reasonably required to permit the search to be carried out, where that person might prejudice the purpose of the search if he were not so detained; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: seize, remove or detain any telecommunications device or other thing found in or on the premises or place that is or that contains, or that appears to the Authority or authorized officer to be or to contain, or to be likely to be or to contain, evidence of the commission of a specified offence.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority or an authorized officer may, in carrying out a search of any premises or place entered under a warrant issued under section 41(1) (power of magistrate to issue search warrant)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect, operate and analyze any telecommunications device or other thing found in or on the premises or place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require to be given or produced to the Authority or authorized officer any information (including but not limited to passwords) or document or other thing as will enable the Authority or authorized officer to inspect, operate and analyze any telecommunications device or other thing referred to in paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: require any information that relates, or that appears to the Authority or authorized officer to relate, or to be likely to relate, to the commission or suspected commission of a specified offence and that is— (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: contained in a computer in, on or accessible from the premises or place; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: contained in any other telecommunications device or other thing found in or on the premises or place and that is capable of being retrieved on a computer,

paragraph.continued: to be produced on a computer in or on the premises or place in a visible and legible form, and examine the information;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require any information described in paragraph (c) to be produced in a form in which it can be taken away and in which it is either visible and legible or capable of being retrieved on a computer; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: take away the copy so produced under paragraph (d).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority or an authorized officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: break into and forcibly enter any premises or place that the Authority or authorized officer is empowered to enter and search under a warrant issued under section 41(1) (power of magistrate to issue search warrant); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remove by force any person or thing obstructing the Authority or authorized officer in the performance of any functions of the Authority or authorized officer under this section.

subsection.content: Where the Authority or an authorized officer arrests a person under subsection (1)(a), the Authority or authorized officer shall, without delay, take the person to a police station to be dealt with there in accordance with the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232) or deliver him into the custody of a police officer for that purpose.
The Authority or an authorized officer may call upon police officers or other public officers to assist the Authority or authorized officer in the performance of any function under this section.
This section is without prejudice to any powers of arrest, entry and search conferred on police officers under any other enactment or rule of law.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Power of magistrate to issue search warrant

subsection.content: Where a magistrate is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for suspecting that there is, or is likely to be, in or on any premises or place any telecommunications device or other thing that is or that contains, or that is likely to be or to contain, evidence of the commission of a specified offence, the magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing the Authority or an authorized officer to enter and search the premises or place.

Where the Authority or an authorized officer enters any premises or place under a warrant issued under subsection (1), the Authority or authorized officer shall, on request, produce the warrant and evidence of identity for inspection by any person found in or on the premises or place. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Obstruction of Authority, authorized officers, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to any other Ordinance, a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs the Authority or an authorized officer in the performance of any functions of the Authority or authorized officer under section 40 (powers of entry, search, arrest, etc.);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wilfully fails to comply with any requirement properly made to him by the Authority or an authorized officer under that section; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to give the Authority or an authorized officer any other assistance that the Authority or authorized officer may reasonably require to be given for the purpose of performing any functions of the Authority or authorized officer under that section,

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to any other Ordinance, a person who makes a statement that he knows to be false or does not believe to be true, or otherwise knowingly misleads the Authority, an authorized officer or any other person in the performance of any functions of the Authority, authorized officer or person under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Recovery of costs and expenses of investigation by Authority

subsection.content: Where a person is convicted by a court of a specified offence on a prosecution instituted as a result of an investigation by the Authority, the court may order the person to pay to the Authority the whole or a part of the costs and expenses of that investigation.

Any costs and expenses awarded to the Authority by an order made under this section shall constitute a debt due to the Authority from the person ordered to pay them and are recoverable as a civil debt.
For the avoidance of doubt, this section is without prejudice to any power conferred on the court under the Costs in Criminal Cases Ordinance (Cap. 492).

subsection.def: In this section, costs and expenses (費用及開支), in relation to an investigation, means staff costs and expenses and the financing of liabilities paid out of the Office of the Communications Authority Trading Fund in respect of that investigation. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

section.name: s44
section.heading: Service of notices for purposes of sections 34, 35, 36 and 38

subsection.leadIn: A specified notice may be served on a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the person is an individual, by delivering it to the person by hand; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by leaving it, or sending it by ordinary post or registered post to the person, at the person’s usual or last known place of abode or business. (Replaced 18 of 2014 s. 51)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: In the absence of evidence to the contrary, the notice is presumed to have been served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the notice is left at the person’s usual or last known place of abode or business, when it is so left; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the notice is sent by ordinary post or registered post, on the second day after the day on which it is so sent. (Added 18 of 2014 s. 51)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, a company within the meaning assigned by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) is deemed to have its usual place of business at its registered office in Hong Kong, and any other organization is deemed to have a usual place of business at its principal office or any other place at which it carries on business. (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

def.name: SpecifiedNotice
def.leadIn: In this section, specified notice (指明通知) means a notice under—

paragraph.name: a
